paper_title.ja: 3%NaCl水溶液中におけるAl_2O_3/金属材料のトライボ特性
paper_title.en: Tribocharacteristics of Metals against Al_2O_3 in 3% NaCl Solution

description.ja: In this study, a wear test was carried out to clarify the effects of the experimental potentials on tribocharacteristics of metals against alumina(Al2O3) in 3% NaCl solution and under different potentials. We used an oscillatory type, and a cylinder-on-disk type test apparatus. As the results show [phosphor bronze(PBB2)] a generally higher wear resistance and lower coefficient of friction than with either carbon steel(S45C) or stainless steel(SUS304). But it does show a lower wear resistance under corrosion potential (COP(+250mV)) than with them. SUS304 shows a generally lower wear resistance and a higher coefficient of friction than with either S45C or PBB2, though it shows a higher wear resistance under corrosion potential (COP(+250mV)). The wear resistance of S45C is easier to receive the effect of the experimental potentials in PBB2 and over SUS304.
description.en: In this study, a wear test was carried out to clarify the effects of the experimental potentials on tribocharacteristics of metals against alumina(Al2O3) in 3% NaCl solution and under different potentials. We used an oscillatory type, and a cylinder-on-disk type test apparatus. As the results show [phosphor bronze(PBB2)] a generally higher wear resistance and lower coefficient of friction than with either carbon steel(S45C) or stainless steel(SUS304). But it does show a lower wear resistance under corrosion potential (COP(+250mV)) than with them. SUS304 shows a generally lower wear resistance and a higher coefficient of friction than with either S45C or PBB2, though it shows a higher wear resistance under corrosion potential (COP(+250mV)). The wear resistance of S45C is easier to receive the effect of the experimental potentials in PBB2 and over SUS304.

paper_title.en: Tribocharacteristics of Sliding Bearing Materials in Seawater : Comparison Experiment of Oscillatory Sliding Type to Ball-on-disc Type
paper_title.ja: 海水すべり軸受材のトライボ特性 : 揺動すべり試験と回転すべり試験の比較

description.ja: This study aimed at finding out a suitable material for sliding bearings used in seawater. We carried out two types of wear experiments: oscillatory sliding type and ball-on-disc type; using phenolic resin, PTFE resin, polyamide (PA) resin and Pb-Cu sintered alloy sliding against SUS304. As a result, PA resin shows high wear resistance and low friction, whereas phenolic and PTFE resin indicates different tribocharacteristics depending on the type of wear experiment. Pb-Cu sintered alloy is an unsuitable material for bearings in seawater because of its high corrosive wear rate and high fiction.
description.en: This study aimed at finding out a suitable material for sliding bearings used in seawater. We carried out two types of wear experiments: oscillatory sliding type and ball-on-disc type; using phenolic resin, PTFE resin, polyamide (PA) resin and Pb-Cu sintered alloy sliding against SUS304. As a result, PA resin shows high wear resistance and low friction, whereas phenolic and PTFE resin indicates different tribocharacteristics depending on the type of wear experiment. Pb-Cu sintered alloy is an unsuitable material for bearings in seawater because of its high corrosive wear rate and high fiction.

paper_title.en: Slidinng Wear Characteristics of Anticorrosive Platings in Artificial Seawater
Sliding wear characteristics of metals against Al2O3 in 3 % NaCl solution

description.en: The corrosive wear resistance and the damage behavior of metals sliding against Al2O3 in 3% NaCl solution were investigated at different normal loads and sliding speeds using a ball on disk tribometer equipped with an electrochemical potentiostat. The obtained results indicate that Cu base materials show higher corrosive wear resistance and lower coefficient of friction than Fe base materials. Especially, BC2 shows an excellent corrosive wear resistance, while the corrosive wear of stainless steel is predominantly affected by sliding speed, that is, higher sliding speed results in stronger adhesion leading to higher wear rate.

paper_title.en: Fretting Damage of Surface Modifications(Comparative Examinations to Uncoated Surface)
A Study of Friction due to Plowing on Beformable Materials

description.en: Generally it is well known that a coefficient of friction in abrasive wear can be expressed theoretically as a summation of the two terms related with a plowing and an adhesive component. It is, however, necessary to correct each term in order to adjust them to actual phenomena. In this work the correction factors to obtain a plowing component and an adhesive component occupied in abrasive wear were experimentally evaluated using a cone with various angles. The test materials investigated are carbon steel as cone specimen and tin and alminium as flat specimen. As results they were much deviated from the calculated values theoretically and the values of the correction factors varied with experimental conditions. © 1999, The Japan Society of Mechanical Engineers. All rights reserved.
